wikipedia_page.main: Earl Rhodes (born July 1962) is an English former television and cinema actor, who was active professionally from the mid-1970s to the late 1980s.

response: * Earl Rhodes, former actor, lives in Isleworth.

| Young Sherlock Holmes || Paramount Pictures / Amblin Entertainment || Barry Levinson (director); Chris Columbus (screenplay); Nicholas Rowe, Alan Cox, Anthony Higgins, Sophie Ward, Roger Ashton-Griffiths, Freddie Jones, Nigel Stock, Brian Oulton, Susan Fleetwood, Earl Rhodes, Patrick Newell, Donald Eccles, Walter Sparrow, Nadim Sawalha, Roger Brierley, Vivienne Chandler, Lockwood West, John Scott Martin, Willoughby Goddard, Ralph Tabakin, Nancy Nevinson, Michael Hordern || Mystery, Adventure || Live action
Gaius was played by Earl Rhodes in the 1976 TV series I, Claudius.

He has published two books; a biography The Theatres of George Devine (Jonathan Cape, 1978) and  Theatre Criticism (Routledge, 1992). His first play, The Houseboy, was performed at the Open Space Theatre in 1973. The play is semi-autobiographical, based on Wardle's experience from a part-time job washing dishes at a London guest house. The production was directed by Charles Marowitz and the cast included Timothy West. A television production was made for ITV's Playhouse season and screened on 3 July 1982, directed by Christopher Hodson.  The cast was Stephen Garlick, Geoffrey Palmer, Richard Pasco and Earl Rhodes.
